qas.question: Literature intended for performance is what?
Drama is sometimes blended with what other elements?
What are two types of drama that incorporate music or dance?
Drama meant to be performed in a theater is what?
What do we call the author of a play?
Drama is literature that is not intended for what?
Poetry is often combined with music and dance, as in what two things?
Nearly all drama took prose form until what general time frame?
What is comprised chiefly of dialogue between two characters?
A closet drama refers to a a play written to be sang instead of what?
What is literature not intended for performance?
What is the oral dramatic work of a playwright called?

plausible_answers.text: a play written to be read rather than to be performed

qas.question: What does a closest drama refer to?
Until when did very little drama take verse form?
What forms of drama combine with music and motion?
Until when did all musical theater take verse form?
What is the composer of an opera called?
What is a closet drama a subset of?

context: <a0_0><b10_0><b17_0>Drama<b17_0/><b10_0/><a0_0/> is literature intended for <b5_0>performance<b5_0/>. The form is often combined with <a1_0>music and dance<a1_0/>, as in <a2_0><b6_0><b14_0>opera and musical theatre<b14_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>. <a3_0><b8_0><b11_0>A play<b11_0/><b8_0/><a3_0/> is a subset of this form, referring to the written dramatic work of <a4_0>a <b16_0>playwright<b16_0/><a4_0/> that is intended for performance in a theatre; it comprises chiefly dialogue between characters, and usually aims at dramatic or theatrical performance rather than at reading. A closet drama, by contrast, refers to <b12_0>a play written to be read rather than to be <b9_0>performed<b12_0/><b9_0/>; hence, it is intended that the meaning of such a work can be realized fully on the page. Nearly all drama took verse form until <b7_0><b13_0><b15_0>comparatively recently<b15_0/><b13_0/>.
